Mobile Seasoned Licensed Barber - Full Time and Part Time

Come join our fun, creative, energetic team in Sandy Springs! We are looking to expand our staff in the well-established Heat Lounge Hair Salon & Spa. This is a high end salon located under a high end apartment complex in the mix of vibrant businesses in addition to our loyal clients of 5+ years that book regular appointments.

The build out of this salon was over 500k+ with new posh upgrades to our furniture, décor, and equipment!

Please contact us now to join our fabulous team if you are ready for a great opportunity in a prestige, high income location in Atlanta with a well-established salon with loyal clients!

website: HeatLoungeHairSalon.com

We are looking for experienced, hardworking and creative stylists to join our team. We have been in the business of beauty for a good while and we are well established.

  • Ability to make all clients feel welcome, advise clients on products while ensuring a high standard of service is essential
  • Must be available to work on the weekends
  • Georgia Barber License is a must, so also the ability to work with all types of hair.
  • Ability to do protective styles and/or barber cuts is a definite plus

Willingness to learn and to keep improving is key as Ongoing training is offered

We offer great weekly pay, plenty room for growth and a friendly, easy going work environment.

html_job_description:
## Job Description

Critical Results Include

MV Transportation is seeking Schedulers who will accept trip reservations from eligible passengers collecting all necessary data required to schedule trips accordingly.
  • Phone calls answered promptly and hold times kept to a minimum and according to contract
  • Passenger database maintained accurately and new entries complete and accurate
  • Reservations complete and accurate, all pertinent information available


Job Responsibilities
  • Answer passenger calls collecting all necessary trip information for the permissible time period
  • Provide system information for current and new passengers as well as for potential passengers on accessing the transportation service and using it effectively
  • Complete data entry of passenger file information and for specific trip requests, negotiating requested times where necessary or appropriate
  • Provide feedback to passengers in the way of follow-up calls as a course of duty or as required by schedule changes
  • Communicate passenger cancellations in a timely manner to scheduling, dispatch, or vehicle operations personnel
  • Maintain up to date passenger records in customer database, making all necessary changes in status, client contact information, fare/rider type or other important field entries
  • Maintain a safe work area and a focus on safety to reduce the opportunity for injury to self or other employees
  • Maintain accurate records and appropriate filing systems
  • Communicate effectively with operations staff regarding scheduling or passenger issues
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks accurately and effectively
  • Excellent customer service
  • Professional demeanor and appearance
  • Reliable in attendance
  • Team player and helpful to staff, management, and peers


Talent Requirements
  • High School diploma or equivalent; some college preferred
  • Previous clerical, data entry, customer service experience preferred but not required
  • Customer service
  • Data entry
  • Knowledge of service area
  • General knowledge of windows-based computer operating systems
  • Ability to read, write and speak both English and Spanish
  • Ability to communicate effectively on all levels
  • Ability to use multi-line phone system

MV Transportation is committed to as policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, genetic information or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances. The information collected by this application is solely to determine suitability for employment, verify identity and maintain employment statistics on applicants.

Where permissible under applicable state and local law, applicants may be subject to a pre-employment drug test and background check after receiving a conditional offer of employment.

Employee Type: Full-Time

Location: Atlanta, GA

Job Type: Customer ServiceOtherTransportation

Experience: Not Specified

Date Posted: 20/11/2020

job_description: Agency Overview We're here to make a difference. Each one of us. If you love creative problem solving and want to collaborate with humans who feel the same way, we may be your kind of place. With the heart of a startup and a spirit of independence, we bring passion, ambition, and boundless energy to every challenge. Are you ready to get after it? If you're not hooked yet, we offer best-in-class benefits, limitless growth opportunities and a chance to transform global brands with the most talented folks in the industry. We work hard. We play harder – whether it's behind the mic, on the bandstand, or rolling around with our four-legged friends. Summary We’re looking for a talented Copywriter who can translate strategic direction into powerful advertising communications. You will get hands-on experience working on projects while collaborating with our talented Creative team. We are looking for ambitious creative types, who are ready to contribute to our diverse client roster. Responsibilities Interact with Art Directors to develop creative concepts and executions of assigned projects Responsible for clear, concise and convincing writing and for grammatical and material accuracy Participate in creative brainstorming Adapt voice and tone for multiple clients and brands Perform additional creative tasks as needed Requirements Passion for words 3-5 years of Copywriting experience Creative portfolio showcasing your best work Excellent writing, editing, and organizational skills Strong written and verbal communication skills Keen attention to detail Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and Mac
html_job_description:
Agency Overview

We're here to make a difference. Each one of us. If you love creative problem solving and want to collaborate with humans who feel the same way, we may be your kind of place. With the heart of a startup and a spirit of independence, we bring passion, ambition, and boundless energy to every challenge. Are you ready to get after it?


If you're not hooked yet, we offer best-in-class benefits, limitless growth opportunities and a chance to transform global brands with the most talented folks in the industry. We work hard. We play harder – whether it's behind the mic, on the bandstand, or rolling around with our four-legged friends.


Summary

We’re looking for a talented Copywriter who can translate strategic direction into powerful advertising communications. You will get hands-on experience working on projects while collaborating with our talented Creative team. We are looking for ambitious creative types, who are ready to contribute to our diverse client roster.


Responsibilities

  • Interact with Art Directors to develop creative concepts and executions of assigned projects
  • Responsible for clear, concise and convincing writing and for grammatical and material accuracy
  • Participate in creative brainstorming
  • Adapt voice and tone for multiple clients and brands
  • Perform additional creative tasks as needed


Requirements

  • Passion for words
  • 3-5 years of Copywriting experience
  • Creative portfolio showcasing your best work
  • Excellent writing, editing, and organizational skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Keen attention to detail
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and Mac

job_description: LJC Business Partners is having amazing success for our clients in Atlanta, and we are hiring!  We are looking for talented and personable people to help meet expansion demand from our clients. Our clients know they can trust us to represent their brands with professionalism and integrity. The entry-level Sales Representative that we hire will initially learn the basics of sales and account acquisition, and then advance into our management development program.  Entry-Level Sales Representatives are responsible for: Meeting with new and existing clients Understanding product knowledge (after full training is complete) Meeting the needs of our clients with integrity Creating a positive experience for our clients’ customers LJC Business Partners offers: Personalized coaching for professional development National and international travel opportunities Full-time, permanent work The opportunity to give back to our community through our various initiatives Upbeat, fun and education-based work atmosphere Performance-based advancement and a structured career path This is an entry-level position. All college graduates are encouraged to apply; however, the following majors, degrees and experiences are the best matches: marketing, business administration, management, entrepreneurship, communications, advertising, public relations, political science, or psychology.  Requirements: Great work-ethic An optimistic attitude Willingness to learn and challenge yourself A genuine interest in helping others Professional demeanor Excellent customer service and interpersonal communication skills
html_job_description:
LJC Business Partners is having amazing success for our clients in Atlanta, and we are hiring! 


We are looking for talented and personable people to help meet expansion demand from our clients. Our clients know they can trust us to represent their brands with professionalism and integrity. The entry-level Sales Representative that we hire will initially learn the basics of sales and account acquisition, and then advance into our management development program. 


Entry-Level Sales Representatives are responsible for:

  • Meeting with new and existing clients
  • Understanding product knowledge (after full training is complete)
  • Meeting the needs of our clients with integrity
  • Creating a positive experience for our clients’ customers


LJC Business Partners offers:

  • Personalized coaching for professional development
  • National and international travel opportunities
  • Full-time, permanent work
  • The opportunity to give back to our community through our various initiatives
  • Upbeat, fun and education-based work atmosphere
  • Performance-based advancement and a structured career path


This is an entry-level position. All college graduates are encouraged to apply; however, the following majors, degrees and experiences are the best matches: marketing, business administration, management, entrepreneurship, communications, advertising, public relations, political science, or psychology. 


Requirements:

  • Great work-ethic
  • An optimistic attitude
  • Willingness to learn and challenge yourself
  • A genuine interest in helping others
  • Professional demeanor
  • Excellent customer service and interpersonal communication skills

job_description: Warehouse Worker Job Responsibilities: Completes shipments by processing and loading orders. Prepares orders by processing requests and supply orders; pulling materials; packing boxes; placing orders in the delivery area. Completes deliveries by driving truck or van to and from vendors. Maintains truck or van by completing preventive maintenance requirements and arranging for repairs. Enforces inventory controls by collecting stock location orders and printing requests. Provides quality service by following organization standards. Preserves safe and clean work environment by keeping shelves, pallet area, and workstations neat. Warehouse Worker Qualifications / Skills: Teamwork Coordination Organization Planning Time management Reporting skills Inventory control Documentation skills Equipment maintenance Data entry skills Dependability Promotes clean shipping supply area by complying with procedures, rules, and regulations. Completes reports by entering required information. Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

job_description: Glamazon Delivery Driver Glam on Demand is a Luxury on Demand Beauty App SHOP Do you have what it takes to Join our Glamazon ranks? We are looking for friendly, customer oriented, Glamazon delivery drivers for the SHOP Feature of our new mobile app. Responsibilities Deliver a wide variety of beauty supply and personal care items to different addresses throughout the metro Atlanta area. Clock in and out on company portal at the beginning and end of shift Maintain a professional and clean appearance while representing the Glam on Demand brand. Pick up product orders from stores, check for accuracy, and make any necessary replacements by contacting the customer. Ask for feedback on provided services and resolve clients’ complaints Collect tips when excellent service is provided Inform customers about new products and services Complete logs and reports Follow DOT regulations and safety standards Skills At least 2 Beauty, Cosmetology, Customer Service, Marketing, Public Relations Sales, or Brand Ambassador Experience in any capacity. Pizzazz (You've gotta have character to sit with us! Some basic knowledge of beauty and self care (ie nails, hair, skin, makeup). We don't expect you to be an exper but we do want you to feel comfortable interacting with the people and brands that we work with. Reliable transportation. (Orders must be picked up from vendor and dropped off to customers) Have your own aesthetic. All Glam is not created equal. We realize that not everyone's glam will include big lashes or long hair, but we do love to work with Glamazons who are not strangers to self- care. A smartphone A positive attitude, self-regulation and conflict resolution skills Valid professional driver’s license Excellent organizational and time management skills Good driving record with minimal traffic violations High school diploma/GED If you think you've got enough sparkle to become a Glamazon, fill out an application or visit www.glamondemand.site for more information. Job Types: Part-time, Commission Pay: $12.00 - $14.00 per hour Benefits: Flexible schedule Schedule: 10 hour shift 12 hour shift 8 hour shift Day shift Monday to Friday No nights Overtime Weekends Year round work Supplemental Pay: Tips COVID-19 considerations: https://www.glamondemand.site/covid-19 License/Certification: Driver's License (Required) Trucking payment: Per trip Typical start time: 6AM Typical end time: 11PM Delivery Location Type: Residential Commercial Vehicle Provided: No Uniform: Company-provided uniform Employee-purchased uniform Employee's own clothing, so long as it meets the company dress code This Job Is: A job for which military experienced candidates are encouraged to apply Open to applicants under 18 years old, provided it is legally allowed for the job and location A job for which all ages, including older job seekers, are encouraged to apply Open to applicants who do not have a college diploma Company's website: www.glamondemand.site Company's Facebook page: www.facebook.com/glamondemandapp Work Remotely: No
html_job_description:
Glamazon Delivery Driver
Glam on Demand is a Luxury on Demand Beauty App

SHOP

Do you have what it takes to Join our Glamazon ranks?

We are looking for friendly, customer oriented, Glamazon delivery drivers for the SHOP Feature of our new mobile app.

Responsibilities

  • Deliver a wide variety of beauty supply and personal care items to different addresses throughout the metro Atlanta area.
  • Clock in and out on company portal at the beginning and end of shift
  • Maintain a professional and clean appearance while representing the Glam on Demand brand.
  • Pick up product orders from stores, check for accuracy, and make any necessary replacements by contacting the customer.
  • Ask for feedback on provided services and resolve clients’ complaints
  • Collect tips when excellent service is provided
  • Inform customers about new products and services
  • Complete logs and reports
  • Follow DOT regulations and safety standards

Skills

  • At least 2 Beauty, Cosmetology, Customer Service, Marketing, Public Relations Sales, or Brand Ambassador Experience in any capacity.
  • Pizzazz (You've gotta have character to sit with us!
  • Some basic knowledge of beauty and self care (ie nails, hair, skin, makeup). We don't expect you to be an exper but we do want you to feel comfortable interacting with the people and brands that we work with.
  • Reliable transportation. (Orders must be picked up from vendor and dropped off to customers)
  • Have your own aesthetic. All Glam is not created equal. We realize that not everyone's glam will include big lashes or long hair, but we do love to work with Glamazons who are not strangers to self- care.
  • A smartphone
  • A positive attitude, self-regulation and conflict resolution skills
  • Valid professional driver’s license
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Good driving record with minimal traffic violations
  • High school diploma/GED

If you think you've got enough sparkle to become a Glamazon, fill out an application or visit www.glamondemand.site for more information.

job_title: Personal Assistant for Theatre Artist in Quarantine
job_description: Seeking Dynamic Individuals NOW HIRING Personal Assistants Theatre artist/musician/actress with severe neuromuscular disability seeking to hire two additional team members. Includes: —Assistance with manual spinal traction, positioning and customized physical therapy routine. —Bathing/massage to stimulate circulatory and lymphatic flow —Hands on healthcare/bodywork experience! —Training provided on site. You will learn a unique skill set including techniques for neuropathway activation. —Perfect for students in healthcare and wellness or creatives who love to move! —Are you a dancer, athlete, artist or former restaurant worker looking for a safer job during the pandemic? We’re COVID-19 safe! We maintain a strictly quarantined environment. —Transfers from Bed to Wheelchair (I weigh around 90lbs) ***For the right candidate, I will offer free rent at a private Airbnb apartment in exchange for a complete quarantine agreement to keep me safe. This would include a quarantine isolation agreement, 6 month commitment and Torchbearer Code of Honor, responsibility to be on call for emergencies and to train subsequent team members.*** —Meditative, artistic atmosphere. Anti-racist and LGBTQ friendly. —Must have good upper body strength and a passion for life! No smoking or fragrances. $20/hr 11:30am—3:30pm, 4-6 days per week PASSION AND PURPOSE My team is hands on, bodywork oriented, with core concentration on my physical therapy and spinal wellness to facilitate open airways, core connection and flow of vital chi. My approach as a team leader (and as a theatre artist) is wholistic, inviting deep presence, courage and principled action. I am looking for a team member who can align with the daily function (my survival and wellness) as well as the Metapurpose of our team (embodied thriving) by showing up as an honorable and ready Torchbearer. The immense body of knowledge and skill sets taught through working with me are an investment and a responsibility. Previous team members “pass the torch” to new team members through hours of hands-on training, and the new Torchbearer is then asked to remember this responsibility and know that the fire must go on. Job Types: Part-time, Contract Pay: $20.00 per hour Schedule: Day shift COVID-19 considerations: *Because of neuromuscular disease I am high risk. For the right candidate, I will offer free rent at an Airbnb apartment for 6 months with the agreement of complete quarantine for COVID safety. License/Certification: Driver's License (Required) Work Remotely: No
html_job_description:
Seeking Dynamic Individuals

NOW HIRING Personal Assistants

Theatre artist/musician/actress with severe neuromuscular disability seeking to hire two additional team members. Includes:

—Assistance with manual spinal traction, positioning and customized physical therapy routine.

—Bathing/massage to stimulate circulatory and lymphatic flow

—Hands on healthcare/bodywork experience!

—Training provided on site. You will learn a unique skill set including techniques for neuropathway activation.

—Perfect for students in healthcare and wellness or creatives who love to move!

—Are you a dancer, athlete, artist or former restaurant worker looking for a safer job during the pandemic? We’re COVID-19 safe! We maintain a strictly quarantined environment.

—Transfers from Bed to Wheelchair (I weigh around 90lbs)

***For the right candidate, I will offer free rent at a private Airbnb apartment in exchange for a complete quarantine agreement to keep me safe. This would include a quarantine isolation agreement, 6 month commitment and Torchbearer Code of Honor, responsibility to be on call for emergencies and to train subsequent team members.***

—Meditative, artistic atmosphere. Anti-racist and LGBTQ friendly.

—Must have good upper body strength and a passion for life! No smoking or fragrances.

$20/hr 11:30am—3:30pm, 4-6 days per week

PASSION AND PURPOSE

My team is hands on, bodywork oriented, with core concentration on my physical therapy and spinal wellness to facilitate open airways, core connection and flow of vital chi. My approach as a team leader (and as a theatre artist) is wholistic, inviting deep presence, courage and principled action.

I am looking for a team member who can align with the daily function (my survival and wellness) as well as the Metapurpose of our team (embodied thriving) by showing up as an honorable and ready Torchbearer. The immense body of knowledge and skill sets taught through working with me are an investment and a responsibility. Previous team members “pass the torch” to new team members through hours of hands-on training, and the new Torchbearer is then asked to remember this responsibility and know that the fire must go on.

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Pay: $20.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Day shift

COVID-19 considerations:
*Because of neuromuscular disease I am high risk. For the right candidate, I will offer free rent at an Airbnb apartment for 6 months with the agreement of complete quarantine for COVID safety.

License/Certification:

  • Driver's License (Required)

Work Remotely:

  • No

job_description: TrailersPlus is the largest network of trailer dealerships in the country with 68 stores and has been in business since 1995! We are a well established organization and are looking for a Parts and Service Assistant to help maintain and grow our customer base. Our industry leading advertising effort and national call center will help generate qualified leads. This is your chance to join an industry leader that is changing how people buy trailers. The starting wage is $500-$700 a week depending on your experience and performance. Commissions are also available for all Trailer, Parts and Labor sales. We are seeking someone who will be responsible for performing a variety of tasks including (but not limited to) Tire, parts and accessories installation Trailer inspection and repair Receiving and processing shipments Facility and grounds maintenance (cleaning and organizing building, shop, trailers, etc.) Our ideal candidate: Showcases enthusiasm, professional attitude and appearance Service oriented to achieve highest level of customer satisfaction Flexible with job responsibilities and willing to help in multiple departments as needed Has an interest in career advancement within our organization Qualifications: Welding experience is a plus, but not required Forklift Certification Required (***Company paid training and certification) Familiarity with basic tools used in trailer repair preferred. We are willing to train the right person if you are motivated, passionate and excited about our quickly growing company and what we do! This position does require flexibility in all areas to ensure smooth operational continuity.We really want to hear from you if this sounds like a job you can excel at and a company you have interest in working for! Please apply and if we feel you fit the criteria that we are seeking, we will be in contact with you as soon as possible. From that point, we will go over the complete job description and see if you are the right fit for us, and if we are the right fit for you. Apply now: If you possess these skills and seek a solid career with an established company, providing quality products and services that are always in high demand, we would welcome hearing from you. Click here: https://www.trailersplus.com/careers/ to start the application process. A member of our HR team will respond quickly to assist all qualified candidates. TrailersPlus is an equal opportunity employer. To learn more, visit us at trailersplus.com Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Schedule: Day shift Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay Commission pay Experience: Welding: 1 year (Preferred) Sales: 1 year (Preferred) Hand tools: 1 year (Preferred) License/Certification: Driver's License (Preferred) Forklift Certification (Preferred) Work Remotely: No

job_description: Are you an energetic go-getter seeking an exciting career opportunity to work alongside the Founder & CEO of one of the largest online websites in the craft beer and spirits industry? If so, we have the job for you! CraftShack is currently searching for a computer (Microsoft Office), savvy Administrative Assistant. Successful candidates will have exceptional organizational and stress-management skills, and prove self-regulating and outcome-oriented. Responsibilities: Provide general administrative and clerical support. Mailing, scanning, faxing, etc. Maintain an electronic and hard-copy filing system. Prepare and modify documents including reports, drafts, memos and emails. Perform a variety of data entry tasks. Place orders for distributors. Manage all inbound lead phone calls, emails, and chats. Explore new opportunities and seek out new craft beer products. Help win-back old customers and improve retention rate. Oversee newsletter and all standard email campaigns. Execute miscellaneous tasks at the request of management. Qualifications: Must have proficiency in MS Word, MS Excel and MS Outlook. QuickBooks preferred. Must have ecommerce experience. Must have customer service experience. Must have strong administrative and organizational skills. Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills. Must have the ability to juggle multiple projects with superb accuracy. Bachelor’s Degree (BA) preferred, but experience is key. Salary depends on skills and experience. Company is privately held and offers flexible benefits, a generous profit bonus plan, and casual dress. To apply, please send your resume and a brief cover letter in confidence by applying through indeed. We hope to hear from you soon! Job Type: Full-time Benefits: Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Schedule: Monday to Friday Weekends Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay Education: Associate (Preferred) Experience: Microsoft Office: 5 years (Preferred) Administrative Experience: 5 years (Preferred) Work Location: Fully Remote

Are you an energetic go-getter seeking an exciting career opportunity to work alongside the Founder & CEO of one of the largest online websites in the craft beer and spirits industry?

If so, we have the job for you!

CraftShack is currently searching for a computer (Microsoft Office), savvy Administrative Assistant. Successful candidates will have exceptional organizational and stress-management skills, and prove self-regulating and outcome-oriented.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide general administrative and clerical support. Mailing, scanning, faxing, etc.
  • Maintain an electronic and hard-copy filing system.
  • Prepare and modify documents including reports, drafts, memos and emails.
  • Perform a variety of data entry tasks.
  • Place orders for distributors.
  • Manage all inbound lead phone calls, emails, and chats.
  • Explore new opportunities and seek out new craft beer products.
  • Help win-back old customers and improve retention rate.
  • Oversee newsletter and all standard email campaigns.
  • Execute miscellaneous tasks at the request of management.

Qualifications:

  • Must have proficiency in MS Word, MS Excel and MS Outlook. QuickBooks preferred.
  • Must have ecommerce experience.
  • Must have customer service experience.
  • Must have strong administrative and organizational skills.
  • Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Must have the ability to juggle multiple projects with superb accuracy.
  • Bachelor’s Degree (BA) preferred, but experience is key.

Salary depends on skills and experience. Company is privately held and offers flexible benefits, a generous profit bonus plan, and casual dress.

To apply, please send your resume and a brief cover letter in confidence by applying through indeed.

We hope to hear from you soon!

job_description: Our client is currently seeking an enthusiastic and energetic Executive Assistant to support the C-suite executives of a growing medical company. This is a very high-level role that interacts with all levels of the organization so professionalism and confidentiality are definite must-haves. Typical duties include: extensive calendar management, liaising with various contacts and acting as a gatekeeper, event planning, managing projects, coordinating extensive domestic and international travel, email correspondence, and much more as needed. The ideal candidate will have at least 7 years of experience supporting C-level executives in a similar industry. The candidate will also have excellent problem-solving skills, a high level of emotional intelligence, excellent verbal and written communication skills, self-direction, and flexibility. This is an amazing opportunity to support a well-established and quickly growing company with tons of room for growth! Compensation: $95k/year + benefits

job_description: ## Job Description MV Transportation is seeking a Reservationist to accept trip reservations from eligible passengers, collecting all necessary data required to schedule trips accordingly. Job Responsibilities Answer passenger calls collecting all necessary trip information for the permissible time period. Provide system information for current and new passengers as well as for potential passengers on accessing the transportation service and using it effectively. Complete data entry of passenger file information and for specific trip requests, negotiating requested times where necessary or appropriate. Provide feedback to passengers in the way of follow-up calls as a course of duty or as required by schedule changes. Communicate passenger cancellations in a timely manner to scheduling, dispatch, or vehicle operations personnel. Maintain up to date passenger records in customer database, making all necessary changes in status, client contact information, fare/rider type or other important field entries. Maintain a safe work area and a focus on safety to reduce the opportunity for injury to self or other employees. Maintain accurate records and appropriate filing systems. Communicate effectively with operations staff regarding scheduling or passenger issues. Ability to handle multiple tasks accurately and effectively. Excellent customer service. Professional demeanor and appearance. Reliable in attendance. Team player and helpful to staff, management, and peers. Talent Requirements High School diploma or equivalent. Able to work in a fast-paced environment. Experience in paratransit scheduling utilizing Trapeze PASS, preferred. Possess excellent decision-making skills. Excellent attendance record. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Telephone speaking and/or call center experience. Computer experience. MV Transportation is committed to as policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, genetic information or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances. The information collected by this application is solely to determine suitability for employment, verify identity and maintain employment statistics on applicants. Where permissible under applicable state and local law, applicants may be subject to a pre-employment drug test and background check after receiving a conditional offer of employment. Employee Type: Full-Time Location: Louisville, KY Job Type: Customer ServiceOtherTransportation Experience: Not Specified Date Posted: 23/11/2020
html_job_description:
## Job Description

MV Transportation is seeking a Reservationist to accept trip reservations from eligible passengers, collecting all necessary data required to schedule trips accordingly.

Job Responsibilities
  • Answer passenger calls collecting all necessary trip information for the permissible time period.
  • Provide system information for current and new passengers as well as for potential passengers on accessing the transportation service and using it effectively.
  • Complete data entry of passenger file information and for specific trip requests, negotiating requested times where necessary or appropriate.
  • Provide feedback to passengers in the way of follow-up calls as a course of duty or as required by schedule changes.
  • Communicate passenger cancellations in a timely manner to scheduling, dispatch, or vehicle operations personnel.
  • Maintain up to date passenger records in customer database, making all necessary changes in status, client contact information, fare/rider type or other important field entries.
  • Maintain a safe work area and a focus on safety to reduce the opportunity for injury to self or other employees.
  • Maintain accurate records and appropriate filing systems.
  • Communicate effectively with operations staff regarding scheduling or passenger issues.
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks accurately and effectively.
  • Excellent customer service.
  • Professional demeanor and appearance.
  • Reliable in attendance.
  • Team player and helpful to staff, management, and peers.


Talent Requirements
  • High School diploma or equivalent.
  • Able to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Experience in paratransit scheduling utilizing Trapeze PASS, preferred.
  • Possess excellent decision-making skills.
  • Excellent attendance record.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Telephone speaking and/or call center experience.
  • Computer experience.

MV Transportation is committed to as policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, genetic information or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances. The information collected by this application is solely to determine suitability for employment, verify identity and maintain employment statistics on applicants.

Where permissible under applicable state and local law, applicants may be subject to a pre-employment drug test and background check after receiving a conditional offer of employment.

Employee Type: Full-Time

Location: Louisville, KY

Job Type: Customer ServiceOtherTransportation

Experience: Not Specified

Date Posted: 23/11/2020

job_description: Veterinary Assistant Careers at Banfield Pet Hospital   For those who want to put their love of pets into action, there are few jobs more rewarding than that of Vet Assistant. While working closely with other pet health care professionals at Banfield, you’ll have the chance to advocate for pets and educate clients on all aspects of pet health. In addition, if your goal is to advance in your career, you’ll have access to a variety of learning and development opportunities along the way.   Job Description Summary:  The Veterinary Assistant is a key member of the hospital team who supports and assists the veterinarians and veterinary technicians, ensuring the safety of pets, clients and other associates, and the continuity of quality veterinary care.   Preferred Education/Licenses:  Certificate of completion from a NAVTA-approved veterinary assistant program or the equivalent combination of education, training and experience that provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities. High school diploma or equivalent preferred.   Preferred Experience:  Must be able to perform all required skills of NAVTA-approved veterinary assistant programs at a level that aids in the efficiency of the practice.
html_job_description:
Veterinary Assistant Careers at Banfield Pet Hospital
 
For those who want to put their love of pets into action, there are few jobs more rewarding than that of Vet Assistant. While working closely with other pet health care professionals at Banfield, you’ll have the chance to advocate for pets and educate clients on all aspects of pet health. In addition, if your goal is to advance in your career, you’ll have access to a variety of learning and development opportunities along the way.
 
Job Description Summary:  The Veterinary Assistant is a key member of the hospital team who supports and assists the veterinarians and veterinary technicians, ensuring the safety of pets, clients and other associates, and the continuity of quality veterinary care.
 
Preferred Education/Licenses:  Certificate of completion from a NAVTA-approved veterinary assistant program or the equivalent combination of education, training and experience that provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities. High school diploma or equivalent preferred.
 
Preferred Experience:  Must be able to perform all required skills of NAVTA-approved veterinary assistant programs at a level that aids in the efficiency of the practice.

job_description: The Dutch Content Editor has a strong background in editing, proofreading, creative content writing, journalism or blogging. They have a great eye for detail. The Content Editor is able to work independently and collaboratively as a part of an international team. The Content Editor is a dynamic and vibrant professional, passionate about modern pop-culture, including Music, Videos, Apps, Books and Podcasts. The Content Editor is eager to learn new skills. What You Will Do Proofread and edit localized content, ensuring cultural appropriateness Find and fix linguistic and content errors Occasionally use your creative writing skills to create content Report linguistic and functional errors Research and verify content accuracy To Be Successful You Will Have Strong, native-level skills in Dutch, with exceptional attention for detail Professional proficiency in English (verbal and written) Cultural savviness and a good sense of judgment on the appropriateness of content for the target country's audience. Subject matter expertise for linguistic issues in the target language, ability to research, and resolve linguistic questions. Knowledge and experience with Mac/iOS products Flexibility and willingness to learn new tools and different procedures Ability to type your native language using the EN keyboard Preferably experience in editing, proofreading, (digital) content creation, creative writing, translation, localization, journalism, marketing or QA Must be able to work on-site in the Culver City office Must have valid work authorization in the US In Return You Can Expect The support and collaboration of a wonderful linguistic team Fun, multicultural work environment Front-row seat to exciting digital content and new products Opportunity to grow as a linguistic content editor professional
html_job_description:
The Dutch Content Editor has a strong background in editing, proofreading, creative content writing, journalism or blogging. They have a great eye for detail. The Content Editor is able to work independently and collaboratively as a part of an international team. The Content Editor is a dynamic and vibrant professional, passionate about modern pop-culture, including Music, Videos, Apps, Books and Podcasts. The Content Editor is eager to learn new skills.

What You Will Do
  • Proofread and edit localized content, ensuring cultural appropriateness
  • Find and fix linguistic and content errors
  • Occasionally use your creative writing skills to create content
  • Report linguistic and functional errors
  • Research and verify content accuracy

To Be Successful You Will Have
  • Strong, native-level skills in Dutch, with exceptional attention for detail
  • Professional proficiency in English (verbal and written)
  • Cultural savviness and a good sense of judgment on the appropriateness of content for the target country's audience.
  • Subject matter expertise for linguistic issues in the target language, ability to research, and resolve linguistic questions.
  • Knowledge and experience with Mac/iOS products
  • Flexibility and willingness to learn new tools and different procedures
  • Ability to type your native language using the EN keyboard
  • Preferably experience in editing, proofreading, (digital) content creation, creative writing, translation, localization, journalism, marketing or QA
  • Must be able to work on-site in the Culver City office
  • Must have valid work authorization in the US

In Return You Can Expect
  • The support and collaboration of a wonderful linguistic team
  • Fun, multicultural work environment
  • Front-row seat to exciting digital content and new products
  • Opportunity to grow as a linguistic content editor professional

job_description: Summary This position is located in the Department of Homeland Security, United States Coast Guard, Eighth Coast Guard District in New Orleans, LA. Responsibilities This provides Maritime Security preparedness planning, subject matter expertise, and technical support for Area Maritime Security (AMS) plans and procedures with a subspecialty in Marine Transportation System (MTS) recovery, as well as serve as a port security planning and maritime security, and infrastructure recovery to include salvage response and resumption of maritime commerce.Being a Coast Guard civilian makes you a valuable member of the Coast Guard team. Typical work assignments include: Developing, maintaining, testing, and when necessary, supporting implementation of AMS (SRP) and MTS recovery plans. Coordinating consultation and advisory and technical support with AMSCs and other stakeholders. Researching, developing, and maintaining data detailing marine salvage response capabilities within Captain of the Port (OTP) Zones covered by AMS Plans. Serving as the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for MTS Recovery Units (MTSRU), MTS Recovery Assist Teams (MTSRATs), or similar Coast Guard supplemental support activity, deploying to field locations when directed, for all forms of Transportation Disruptions. Providing preparedness planning and incident management technical support for the development of linkages, compatibility and mutual support among AMS, Area Contingency, natural disaster, mass rescue, radiological/nuclear detection, and similar port-level plans and procedures. Assessing maritime security risks to MTS recovery waterways and harbor clearances including salvage response activities and coordinated planning and implementation of deterrence and protection measures. Requirements Conditions of Employment U.S. Citizenship is required. This position requires a Secret clearance. Males born after 12/31/1959 must be registered for Selective Service. All qualification requirements must be met by the closing date of the announcement. This includes Time-In-Grade requirements for current status employees applying through merit promotion procedures. Status applicants applying for a promotion must have 52 weeks of service at the next lower grade. Qualifications To Qualify at the GS-12 GRADE LEVEL:Applicants must have one year of specialized experience equivalent to the GS-11 in federal service. Specialized experience is experience that has equipped you with the particular ability, skill, and knowledge to successfully perform the duties of this position and is typically in or related to this line of work. Examples of specialized experience include: Providing Maritime Security preparedness planning, subject matter expertise and technical support for Area Maritime Security (AMS) Plans (AMSP's) and procedures with a subspecialty in Marine Transportation System (MTS) recovery, including marine salvage and removal of obstructions to navigation. National Service Experience (i.e., volunteer experience): Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.The Office of Personnel management (OPM) must authorize employment offers made to current or former political appointees. If you are currently, or have been within the last 5 years, a political Schedule A, Schedule, C, Non-career SES or Presidential Appointee employee in the Executive Branch, you must disclose this information to the Human Resources Office. Education This position does not have a positive education requirement. If you are including education on your resume, report only attendance and/or degrees from schools accredited by accrediting institutions recognized by the U.S. Department of Education. See Required Documents section for detail. FOREIGN EDUCATION: Education completed in foreign colleges or universities may be used to meet Federal qualification requirements if you can show that your foreign education is comparable to education received in accredited educational institutions in the United States. It is your responsibility to provide such evidence with your application. See Recognition of Foreign Qualifications click here Additional Information Applicants will be required to complete questions contained on the Declaration for Federal Employment (OF-306) at the time a tentative job offer is made. Certain responses on the form could pose a problem with suitability for employment determinations. If you receive a conditional offer of employment for this position, you will be required to complete/make updates to the OF-306 and to sign and certify the accuracy of all information in your application, prior to entry on duty. False statements on any part of the application may result in withdrawal of offer of employment, dismissal after beginning work, or imprisonment.DHS uses e-Verify, an Internet-based system, to confirm the eligibility of all newly hired employees to work in the United States. Learn more about e-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities at click hereAll Federal employees are required to have Federal salary payments made by direct deposit.The Department of Homeland Security encourages persons with disabilities to apply, to include persons with intellectual, severe physical or psychiatric disabilities, as defined by 5 CFR 213.3102(u), and/or Disabled Veterans with a compensable service-connected disability of 30 percent or more as defined by 5 CFR 315.707. Veterans, Peace Corps/VISTA volunteers, and persons with disabilities possess a wealth of unique talents, experiences, and competencies that can be invaluable to the DHS mission. If you are a member of one of these groups, you may not have to compete with the public for federal jobs. To determine your eligibility for non-competitive appointment and to understand the required documentation, click on the links above or contact the Servicing Human Resources Office listed at the bottom of this announcement.More than 1 selection may be made from this announcement if additional identical vacancies in the same title, series, grade, and unit occur within 45 days from the date the certificate was issued.If you need a reasonable accommodation for the application and hiring process, please contact 202-795-6287. Decisions on granting reasonable accommodation will be made on a case-by-case basis. Visit Reasonable Accommodation

Decisions on granting reasonable accommodation will be made on a case-by-case basis. Visit Reasonable Accommodation

job_description: Description SHIFT: Days (rotating weekends) SCHEDULE: Full-time Registered Respiratory Therapist Do you have the career opportunities as a Respiratory Therapist you want in your current role? We have an exciting opportunity for you to join Tulane Medical Center a facility that is part of the nation's leading provider of healthcare services, HCA Healthcare. Benefits We offer a variety of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans along with some unique benefits including At Tulane Medical Center we want to ensure your needs are met. Paid Personal Leave 401k (100% annual match – 3%-9% of pay based on years of service) Identity Theft Protection discounts Auto, Home, and Life Insurance options Adoption Assistance Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP) How we build better communities Our teams are a committed, caring group of colleagues. Do you want to work as a Respiratory Therapist where your passion for creating positive patient interactions are valued? If you are dedicated to caring for the well-being of others, this could be your next opportunity. We want your knowledge and expertise! Respiratory therapy is best described as the assessment and treatment of patients with both acute and chronic dysfunction of the cardiopulmonary system. Today’s respiratory therapists have demanding responsibilities related to patient care and serve as vital members of the healthcare team. Respiratory therapists must have a broad knowledge of the pathophysiology of the cardiopulmonary system and the complex procedures required to properly diagnose and treat patients, from the very young to the very old. About This Unit Teamwork is the core of how we operate Engagement of Leadership – Everyone on the team is motivated and patient focused. Dynamic Departmental Duties The Staff Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT) provides therapeutic, diagnostic, and emergency services in the critical and acute care setting related to care of the airway and cardiopulmonary system under physician direction. Scope of service includes managing equipment, performing assessments, providing patient care, and educating the patient, family and staff. Performs other duties as assigned. Responsibilities Medical gas administration and aerosol therapy Obtaining and analyzing blood specimens Operating and maintaining various respiratory and cardiopulmonary equipment Maintain artificial airways, provide mechanical ventilation and assist with CPR as needed Provide patient education Assess equipment function and monitor patient response to therapy Qualifications Qualifications: NBRC credentials and licensed by LSBME as a Registered Respiratory Therapist; current CPR/BCLS required, ACLS and PALS required within 1 year. Graduate of JCRCE accredited Registered Respiratory Therapist entry level program. Minimum one year post graduate clinical experience preferred. Must be able to successfully complete established competencies for the position within designated probationary period. Work Schedule: Full-time - Day shift(7:00 am-7:00 pm) With 235+ beds, Tulane Medical Center is an acclaimed teaching, research and medical center serving the greater New Orleans area. Tulane Medical Center has been named a World’s Best Hospital by Newsweek in its 2019 listing of the top medical facilities across the globe. Of the 1,000 hospitals listed in the report, Tulane Medical Center is one of just 250 “World’s Best Hospitals” found in the United States and the only hospital in southern Louisiana on the list. At Tulane, our mission statement reminds us that above all else we are committed to the care and improvement of human life. When we speak of our mission, we usually think about our dedication to patients and their families and our commitment to them. But we are also equally committed to our employees. You are part of an organization with a long history of compassion and service to patients. The degree to which we as an organization can provide quality healthcare service is highly dependent on how well you are able to perform your job. HCA Healthcare has been continually named a World's Most Ethical Company by Ethisphere since 2010. In 2018, HCA Healthcare spent an estimated $3.3 billion in cost for the delivery of charitable care, uninsured discounts, and other uncompensated expenses. If you are looking for an opportunity that provides satisfaction and personal growth, we encourage you to apply for our Respiratory Therapist opening. We promptly review all Notice Our Company’s recruiters are here to help unlock the next possibility within your career and we take your candidate experience very seriously. During the recruitment process, no recruiter or employee will request financial or personal information (Social Security Number, credit card or bank information, etc.) from you via email. The recruiters will not email you from a public webmail client like Gmail or Yahoo Mail. If you feel suspicious of a job posting or job-related email, let us know by clicking here. For questions about your job application or this site please contact HCAhrAnswers at 1-844-422-5627 option 1.

Description

SHIFT: Days (rotating weekends)

SCHEDULE: Full-time

Registered Respiratory Therapist

Do you have the career opportunities as a Respiratory Therapist you want in your current role? We have an exciting opportunity for you to join Tulane Medical Center a facility that is part of the nation's leading provider of healthcare services, HCA Healthcare.

Benefits

We offer a variety of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans along with some unique benefits including

At Tulane Medical Center we want to ensure your needs are met.
    • Paid Personal Leave
    • 401k (100% annual match – 3%-9% of pay based on years of service)
    • Identity Theft Protection discounts
    • Auto, Home, and Life Insurance options
    • Adoption Assistance
    • Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP)
How we build better communities

Our teams are a committed, caring group of colleagues. Do you want to work as a Respiratory Therapist where your passion for creating positive patient interactions are valued? If you are dedicated to caring for the well-being of others, this could be your next opportunity. We want your knowledge and expertise!

Respiratory therapy is best described as the assessment and treatment of patients with both acute and chronic dysfunction of the cardiopulmonary system. Today’s respiratory therapists have demanding responsibilities related to patient care and serve as vital members of the healthcare team.

Respiratory therapists must have a broad knowledge of the pathophysiology of the cardiopulmonary system and the complex procedures required to properly diagnose and treat patients, from the very young to the very old.

About This Unit
  • Teamwork is the core of how we operate
  • Engagement of Leadership – Everyone on the team is motivated and patient focused.
  • Dynamic Departmental Duties

The Staff Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT) provides therapeutic, diagnostic, and emergency services in the critical and acute care setting related to care of the airway and cardiopulmonary system under physician direction. Scope of service includes managing equipment, performing assessments, providing patient care, and educating the patient, family and staff. Performs other duties as assigned.

Responsibilities
  • Medical gas administration and aerosol therapy
  • Obtaining and analyzing blood specimens
  • Operating and maintaining various respiratory and cardiopulmonary equipment
  • Maintain artificial airways, provide mechanical ventilation and assist with CPR as needed
  • Provide patient education
  • Assess equipment function and monitor patient response to therapy

Qualifications

Qualifications:
  • NBRC credentials and licensed by LSBME as a Registered Respiratory Therapist; current CPR/BCLS required, ACLS and PALS required within 1 year.
  • Graduate of JCRCE accredited Registered Respiratory Therapist entry level program.
  • Minimum one year post graduate clinical experience preferred.
  • Must be able to successfully complete established competencies for the position within designated probationary period.
  • Work Schedule: Full-time - Day shift(7:00 am-7:00 pm)
With 235+ beds, Tulane Medical Center is an acclaimed teaching, research and medical center serving the greater New Orleans area. Tulane Medical Center has been named a World’s Best Hospital by Newsweek in its 2019 listing of the top medical facilities across the globe. Of the 1,000 hospitals listed in the report, Tulane Medical Center is one of just 250 “World’s Best Hospitals” found in the United States and the only hospital in southern Louisiana on the list.

At Tulane, our mission statement reminds us that above all else we are committed to the care and improvement of human life. When we speak of our mission, we usually think about our dedication to patients and their families and our commitment to them. But we are also equally committed to our employees. You are part of an organization with a long history of compassion and service to patients. The degree to which we as an organization can provide quality healthcare service is highly dependent on how well you are able to perform your job.

HCA Healthcare has been continually named a World's Most Ethical Company by Ethisphere since 2010. In 2018, HCA Healthcare spent an estimated $3.3 billion in cost for the delivery of charitable care, uninsured discounts, and other uncompensated expenses.

If you are looking for an opportunity that provides satisfaction and personal growth, we encourage you to apply for our Respiratory Therapist opening. We promptly review all

job_description: Description: REQUIREMENTS FOR SUCCESS What are the feelings you have when you are at the top of your profession? How does it make you feel knowing that you helped someone's business grow while also being compensated? Imagine an environment that was free of capped commissions. A place where management takes the time to invest in its most valuable asset... YOU! At Networx our company is that of a growth mindset and we genuinely believe that the word difficult is really the word opportunity in disguise. With over 15 years of experience in growing ourselves and our customer's businesses, we have created a remote culture that is engaging and gets you excited about the prospect of getting up in the morning and helping other business' grow. Not because we make good money, (which we do!) but because you genuinely like the company and your coworkers. Take a step forward and truly put yourself in a place where the hard work, dedication and desire to be the best at what you do is recognized. What does that look like to you? If You: • Are Fluent in English and Spanish • Have trouble taking No for an answer • Are tenacious and resilient • Have a proven record of accomplishment meeting and exceeding sales goals • Are a confident self-starter • Are coachable and adaptable • Have a bachelor's degree, or equivalent sales experience Then We: • Provide a generous base + uncapped commissions • Have industry-leading training in sales theory and application • Create an anabolic remote team-oriented environment where we celebrate each other's success • Offer daily, weekly and monthly bonus opportunities Our Sales Reps: • Cold call potential clients with the intent of closing the deal upon initial contact • Manage potential inquires • Meet daily, weekly, and monthly goals • Apply the Networx sales process • Adhere to quality assurance policies and procedures • CLOSE DEALS!! You'll Love: • Family feel • Seeing results from the work you put in • That your opinion matters We Love: • Supplying continuous learning and development over your entire career • Teaching people how to be more successful in life and business, not just sales • Listening to great minds like you • Recognizing you for your excellence and impact • Giving back to our community MISSION & CULTURE: Networx is a coach centric, value-driven company. Our mission is to provide the best home improvement experience, stress free. We believe in striving to continually raise the bar for excellence in partnering, service, and product for home improvement professionals. We believe in providing our uncompromising commitment to WOW customer service. We believe in building a positive team and family spirit; to care for and to challenge each other. We believe in connection. We believe that what others may see as failure is our opportunity to learn and grow. We always celebrate success. We genuinely care for our customers and each other, and we hold our core company values sacred. Networx is currently working fully remotely. When the decision is made to return to working in the office, we are located in the heart of Buckhead, one block from Lenox Marta Station. We offer an aesthetically inviting workplace loaded with games including basketball, foosball, corn hole, chess, and shuffleboard. These are just a few of the ways we help employees decompress for a while at work. Additional perks include gourmet coffee, fresh fruit and snacks served daily, and breakfast provided every Friday. Additional amenities include onsite car detailing, dry-cleaning services, restaurants, and a gym. Remote Working Requirements: The successful candidate should be well versed in teleworking environments, have stable internet service/connection, and have necessary equipment including a fully functioning computer and headset. Strong and intuitive computer skills and familiarity with Zoom and G-Suite is essential. Time management, written and verbal communication skills are vital for success in this role. Previous remote sales experience preferred. BENEFITS & PERKS: We offer a competitive salary and benefits package including medical, dental, vision, company paid life & disability, paid time off and paid holidays. Employer 401(k) match, accident and critical care coverage and an employee assistance program. Visit us on GlassDoor for a deeper look inside our company's culture: Click here We look forward to the beginning of your new career! Job Type: Full-time Travel & Driving Requirements: Negligible. Physical Requirements: Typical physical abilities required of an administrative/office role such as sitting for extended periods of time at a computer workstation; using hands and motor skills on a frequent basis for functions such as keyboard data entry input; clear vision to read and interpret documents, reports, and information on a computer screen; ability to receive detailed information through oral communication, perceiving the nature of sounds at normal speaking levels with or without correction, etc. Networx proudly supports diversity in the workplace and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. DISCLAIMER: The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. PM20 .Requirements:
html_job_description:
Description:




REQUIREMENTS FOR SUCCESS


What are the feelings you have when you are at the top of your profession? How does it make you feel knowing that you helped someone's business grow while also being compensated? Imagine an environment that was free of capped commissions. A place where management takes the time to invest in its most valuable asset... YOU! At Networx our company is that of a growth mindset and we genuinely believe that the word difficult is really the word opportunity in disguise. With over 15 years of experience in growing ourselves and our customer's businesses, we have created a remote culture that is engaging and gets you excited about the prospect of getting up in the morning and helping other business' grow. Not because we make good money, (which we do!) but because you genuinely like the company and your coworkers. Take a step forward and truly put yourself in a place where the hard work, dedication and desire to be the best at what you do is recognized. What does that look like to you?





If You:


• Are Fluent in English and Spanish


• Have trouble taking No for an answer


• Are tenacious and resilient


• Have a proven record of accomplishment meeting and exceeding sales goals


• Are a confident self-starter


• Are coachable and adaptable


• Have a bachelor's degree, or equivalent sales experience





Then We:


• Provide a generous base + uncapped commissions


• Have industry-leading training in sales theory and application


• Create an anabolic remote team-oriented environment where we celebrate each other's success


• Offer daily, weekly and monthly bonus opportunities





Our Sales Reps:


• Cold call potential clients with the intent of closing the deal upon initial contact


• Manage potential inquires


• Meet daily, weekly, and monthly goals


• Apply the Networx sales process


• Adhere to quality assurance policies and procedures


• CLOSE DEALS!!





You'll Love:


• Family feel


• Seeing results from the work you put in


• That your opinion matters





We Love:


• Supplying continuous learning and development over your entire career


• Teaching people how to be more successful in life and business, not just sales


• Listening to great minds like you


• Recognizing you for your excellence and impact


• Giving back to our community





MISSION & CULTURE: Networx is a coach centric, value-driven company. Our mission is to provide the best home improvement experience, stress free. We believe in striving to continually raise the bar for excellence in partnering, service, and product for home improvement professionals. We believe in providing our uncompromising commitment to WOW customer service. We believe in building a positive team and family spirit; to care for and to challenge each other. We believe in connection. We believe that what others may see as failure is our opportunity to learn and grow. We always celebrate success. We genuinely care for our customers and each other, and we hold our core company values sacred.




Networx is currently working fully remotely. When the decision is made to return to working in the office, we are located in the heart of Buckhead, one block from Lenox Marta Station. We offer an aesthetically inviting workplace loaded with games including basketball, foosball, corn hole, chess, and shuffleboard. These are just a few of the ways we help employees decompress for a while at work. Additional perks include gourmet coffee, fresh fruit and snacks served daily, and breakfast provided every Friday. Additional amenities include onsite car detailing, dry-cleaning services, restaurants, and a gym.




Remote Working Requirements: The successful candidate should be well versed in teleworking environments, have stable internet service/connection, and have necessary equipment including a fully functioning computer and headset. Strong and intuitive computer skills and familiarity with Zoom and G-Suite is essential. Time management, written and verbal communication skills are vital for success in this role. Previous remote sales experience preferred.




BENEFITS & PERKS: We offer a competitive salary and benefits package including medical, dental, vision, company paid life & disability, paid time off and paid holidays. Employer 401(k) match, accident and critical care coverage and an employee assistance program.





Visit us on GlassDoor for a deeper look inside our company's culture: Click here





We look forward to the beginning of your new career!





Job Type: Full-time





Travel & Driving Requirements: Negligible.





Physical Requirements: Typical physical abilities required of an administrative/office role such as sitting for extended periods of time at a computer workstation; using hands and motor skills on a frequent basis for functions such as keyboard data entry input; clear vision to read and interpret documents, reports, and information on a computer screen; ability to receive detailed information through oral communication, perceiving the nature of sounds at normal speaking levels with or without correction, etc. Networx proudly supports diversity in the workplace and is an Equal Opportunity Employer.





DISCLAIMER: The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.


PM20

html_job_description:
The Armani Group is one of the leading fashion and luxury goods groups in the world today with 10,500 direct employees, 12 production plants and more than 2,704 boutiques in 60 countries around the world. It designs, manufactures, distributes and retails fashion and lifestyle products including apparel, accessories, eyewear, watches, jewelry, home interiors, fragrances and cosmetics under brand names: Giorgio Armani, Emporio Armani and A|X Armani Exchange.

OVERVIEW OF POSITION:

The responsibilities of the Temporary Associate Client Advisor include, but are not limited to provide prompt, attentive and knowledgeable assistant to all clients, support the staff in order to achieve and surpass goals, and to insure the highest standards of client service are maintained at all times.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES:

Sales Performance

o Develop sales technique to insure maximum performance

o Identify and meet clients' needs

o Utilize all available sales tools to increase business and improve results

o Overcome client objections and offer alternatives

o Comply with all sales related policies and procedures

o Utilize suggestive selling techniques to maximize and accessorize a sale

o Close the sale and monitor all details alterations, shipping, delivery and special client requests

o Collaborate with all associates to achieve departmental and store goals

o Attend all meetings and seminars to insure knowledge to provide maximum results

o Minimizes returns

Product Knowledge

o Possess an in-depth knowledge of the merchandise

o Consistently seek to increase product knowledge

o Maintain a keen interest in the fashion industry and market trends

o Utilize product knowledge to increase sales

o Identify fit/product concerns in a timely manner

o Have an understanding of competitors' products

Client Service

o Provide the highest level of client service

o Maintain constant floor presence to assist clients

o Acknowledge all clients

o Develop rapport with clients

o Build and maintain repeat clientele

o Maintain consistent communication with clients

o Resolve all client problems and complaints quickly and effectively insure management involvement when appropriate

o Identify and implement new ways of increasing client base

o Monitor client purchases and client database

o Insure complete client satisfaction through to client use of purchase

Selling Floor

o Participate in merchandising moves and maintain merchandising directives

o Possess a basic understanding of the company's visual and merchandising standards and philosophy

o Understand merchandise themes to convey to clients

o Return all items, clean and well maintained, to their correct place

o Participate in keeping the selling floor and merchandise clean and organized

o Participate in insuring the correct visual image is reflected on the floor at all times

Inventory

o Possess thorough knowledge of stock location and organization both on and off the selling floor

o Participate in inventory control by insuring tickets and sensors on all garments

o Participate in inventory, cycle counts and stock rotations as requested

Loss Prevention

o Be aware of potential risk to the company and all associates in relation to theft, shrinkage and breakage and inform the appropriate person

o Respect and abide by all Loss Prevention policies, procedures and directives

o Report any and all health or safety concerns to the appropriate person and contribute to a safe environment

Alterations

o Actively manage the fitting process and collaborate with the alterations personnel to insure quality and client service standards

o Respect and abide by all Alterations polices, procedures and directives

o Complete and execute all alterations paperwork in a timely and effective manner

Point-of-Sale

o Possess a thorough understanding of all point-of-sales policies and procedures

o Collaborate with point-of-sale staff to insure all client information is gathered and correctly processed

o Respect and abide by all register policies and procedures

o Effectively utilize style locator and customer profile systems

Shipping/Receiving

o Respect and abide by all shipping/receiving policies, procedures and directives

o Collaborate with shipping/receiving staff to insure client service standards of delivery and shipping

Special Events

o Participate in special events, inclusive of trunk shows, client functions, sale events, etc., as requested

QUALIFICATIONS:

1+ years sales experience in a similar high end related field

If you are looking for a company where you are treated not as a truck number but as part of the family, then this is the perfect time to join the Paul TEAM!

Benefits
  • Earn .46 CPM with 9 Months Experience
  • Home Every Weekend
  • OTR Drivers Average 2,400 Miles Weekly
  • $25.00 Tarp Pay & $25.00 Un-Tarp
  • $25.00 Stop Pay
  • $250.00 Orientation Pay
  • Newer Equipment, Including 2019 2020 Kenworth T680
  • Load Securement Training
  • Medical, Vision, Dental 401K Match
  • Rider Policy
  • Pet Policy
  • Dedicated and OTR Opportunities Available!

Flatbed Driver Requirements
  • Possess a valid Class A C.D.L
  • 6 Months of Flatbed Experience Out of the Last 12 months or 9 months Tractor Trailer Experience in the Last 3 Years
  • No DWI/DUI in the past 5 years
  • Load Securement Training
  • Minimum of 22 years of age
  • No more than 3 moving violations in the past 3 years
  • Pass a completed D.O.T. physical and NIDA drug screen

Qualified candidates, start TODAY!

Call (866) 990-5053 or Click to Apply!
